p: To characterize current global climates, we used data available from the WorldClim archive ( www.worldclim.org), which comprise19 bioclimatic variables derived from monthly temperature and rainfall values collected during 1950–2000 [ 24]. We used the 10ˈ spatial resolution in light of the global extent of our modeling efforts. For future conditions, we obtained data based on GCM outputs for 2050. These data comprised four RCPs spanning broadly different emissions scenarios into the future. Our future-climate projections thus summarized 62 combinations ( S1 File). We used bioclimatic variables derived from monthly temperature and precipitation values because they are known factors in BTV transmission risk [ 1, 25, 26].
